alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 5:03PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Catoosa, Walker and Dade Counties through 545 PM EST... At 502 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Haletown (guild) to New Hope to near Stephensville to near Higdon, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, Lookout Mountain, La Fayette, Chattanooga Valley, Rising Fawn, Noble, Cole City, Wildwood, Fairview, Stephensville, Linwood, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Hooker, Cloudland Canyon State Park and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
